text: A field of wild Siam tulips in Pa Hin Ngam National Park, Thailand Curcuma alismatifolia, Siam tulip or summer tulip (, ; , ; , ) is a tropical plant native to Laos, northern Thailand, and Cambodia.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesSirirugsa, P., Larsen, K. & Maknoi, C. (2007). The genus Curcuma L. (Zingiberaceae): distribution and classification with reference to species diversity in Thailand. Gardens' Bulletin Singapore 59: 203-220. Despite its name, it is not related to the tulip, but to the various ginger species such as turmeric. It can grow as an indoor plant, and is also sold as a cut flower. One of the most famous wild fields of Siam tulips is in Pa Hin Ngam National Park in Chaiyaphum Province, Thailand. Malvidin 3-rutinoside is a pigment responsible for bract color in C. alismatifolia. == References == == External links == Category:Flora of Cambodia Category:Flora of Laos Category:Flora of Thailand Category:Plants described in 1903 alismatifolia
